cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 miles SSW of Tampa Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north then north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward Florida’s Big Bend, afterwards crossing southeast Georgia and exiting off the Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near/just southeast of Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Chokoloskee to Englewood FL and from the mouth of the St. Mary’s River GA to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Middle of Longboat Key northward to Indian Pass, including Tampa Bay; Storm Surge Warning from Englewood northward to Indian Pass including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west-central and Big Bend coast of Florida, spreading inland across southeast Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely, with a chance of hurricane-force gusts as the core passes north of Tampa Bay
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–7 ft of inundation possible in Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee, during high tide Wednesday
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated 12-inch totals possible, producing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning later Tuesday; dangerous surf and rip currents
